Hi Criselda,

Hope you are doing well!

Looping in for Adriane—we have our team set it up so it's easier for you to link the technical drawings and downloads pop-up.

For the technical drawings, you can add #af-design to the product page. See sample below:
https://acoufelt.com.au/solution/screens/#af-design

For the downloads pop-up, you can add ?download=true to the product page. See sample below:
https://acoufelt.com.au/solution/screens/?download=true

Kindly check if that's all good on your end.

Let us know if you need anything else in the meantime.

full_threads.body:
Hey Criselda,

Just a quick update:
  • The Fracture Panel post is now back up and displaying the updated details—apologies again for the inconvenience last week.
  • For future edits, please use “Edit as Post” instead of “Edit with Elementor”. There’s a dedicated template in place for all existing Solutions posts, so this ensures consistency and avoids layout issues.
  • The “Technical Document” popup isn’t set up as a traditional anchor link, so it can’t be customized in the usual way.
  • Just a heads-up: making direct changes to the popup may cause display or functionality issues, since it’s more technically coded and not fully editable via Elementor. If there's a particular way you'd like this to work, feel free to let us know—we’re happy to help.

Let me know if there’s anything else you need—always happy to support!

Hi Adriane

Could you ensure that you get the Fracture Panel page back up on Monday? As it displays old details now.

As adding the anchor link is tricky as these product pages are coded and not entirely created within Elementor, could you just send me the URL also on Monday? Or if there's an alternative way other than what you have suggested earlier.

Thank you

Warm regards,

Criselda Romero
Digital Marketing Manager

Hey again Criselda,

Happy Friday—and so sorry for the delay in getting back to you!

Here’s how you can set up those anchor links:
  • Based on your screenshot, to edit the page, click Edit Post, then Edit with Elementor
  • To add a new element inside a container, click the ‘+’ icon next to the Elementor logo
  • For anchor links, you can use elements like Menu Anchor or a Button—just drag it into the section you want

For the popup:
  • Head to your WordPress Dashboard → Crocoblock → Dashboard
  • Hover over JetPopup then go to All Popups
  • Search for the popup you're looking for (like Technical Documents)—you’ll find the details there

Let me know if anything’s unclear or if you want me to walk through it with you—always happy to help!
